description.narrative: Sector: Waste Management .Beneficiaries: YAL Youth 1,012 of which 506 are women...The grant will be used to provide alternative approach to solid waste management among 500 households in Mukono. Through targeted sensitization of households in proper handling and management of solid waste with emphasis on sorting of waste at home. In addition, they will also be trained in kitchen/home garden establishment and management as an additional incentive which will enable them improve their nutrition and also utilize the composted manure from the biodegraded wastes. After the period of 7 to 14 days, used garbage collection bags will be collected by the project team to the collection center. While at the collection center, garbage will farther be sorted, and decomposing substances processed into organic manure, light plastics and polythene heated and mixed with sand to make high quality pavers, while others with the recommended gauges sold out to the recycling plants. The other materials will be processed into charcoal briquettes. ..The grant funds will be used to: (a) increase infrastructure to increase sales; (b) trash pick-up vehicles; (c) briquette and paver machine to convert waste; (d) trainings on sensitization; and (e) technical assistance. .

The breeding program will introduce a cross breed of local goats with improved Savannah bucks and a training of farmers and students on basic modern farm management which will increase the income of 50 targeted farmers. description.narrative: Sector: Agriculture. Crops - Maize and Groundnuts. Beneficiaries: 1940 Smallholder farmers, of whom 660 are women. Project Description: Katine Joint Farmers Cooperative Society Ltd. (KAJOFACO) is a registered farmers primary cooperative based in Soroti District. The cooperative aims to improve its smallholder members livelihoods through: increasing the production and quality of produce (grain); bulking; collective marketing; value addition; and access to markets. The cooperative has challenges that are limiting the growth of the business such as lack of modern production equipment (at farmer level), insufficient working capital to enable them trade in bigger volumes of produce and lack of transport to carry produce from aggregation centers to the main store. USADF funds will be provided to increase farmers access to production inputs, promoting wide adoption of good agricultural practices (GAPs), and improving post-harvest handling of produce. It will also help enhance produce aggregation, value addition/processing and increasing farmer access to profitable markets..

description.narrative: The Young Farmers Champions Network (YOFCHAN) is an umbrella organization for youth in agriculture in Uganda. Its mandate is to lobby and advocate for an enabling environment that promotes youth engagement in agriculture as a business. YOFCHAN focuses on lobby and advocacy for youth inclusion in the agricultural sector policies and agribusiness development of young farmers enterprises. To achieve this, YOFCHAN organizes platforms that bring the young farmers and policy makers together to discuss issues affecting youth in agriculture and builds their capacity to engage in agriculture as a business. YOFCHANs ultimate goal is to improve youth livelihoods through agriculture.

The cooperative is engaged in the multiplication of high iron bean seed for distribution to farmers through certified seed companies. The cooperative faces a number of challenges that are limiting its growth. .USADF funds used for crop finance to facilitate KFCS to purchase produce directly from farmer members at the time of harvest, which will help limit side-selling to other buyers; establishment of an input to help members gain access to quality inputs including certified seeds; procurement of drying, sorting and packing equipment; completion of a storage facility; and procurement of a truck for transportation of produce. Some of the funds will be used to improving the cooperatives technical and management capacity through recruitment and training of technical staff. .

title.narrative: Echoing Green (EG) COVID 19 - Khainza Energy Limited

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to provide funding to Arthur Woniala to acquire inventory of 500 liquefied petroleum gas cylinders weighing 6kgs each, and to purchase motorcycles for efficient delivery purposes. In addition, funding will also be used to upgrade the companys online platforms to streamline the orders and delivery process, with remote trainings as an added feature. Rent payment for office spaces will also be covered for the months of April, May and June. Lastly, staff salary will be able to get paid off for three existing employees and eight newly recruited youths for the month of June and July. Some of the grant funds will also be used to support families of elderly farmers who have been previously diagnosed with respiratory infections, and are at great risk of contracting COVID-19.
